oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Farm & Riding Stable barns, Ithaca College, Ithaca, NY, with animal pen in foreground, some livestock shown, exterior view from the East, taken August 10, 1966.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: From 1964 until the early 1970s, the College kept riding horses and a domestic animal menagerie in the "College Farm" barns shown, on the South edge of campus. The farm included riding horses, Hereford cattle, a pig, sheep, goats, chickens, and peacocks. The Farm was closed in 1971, while the riding stable continued for a few years. The barns, which were acquired with the property, are still in use for storage (2002).
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Smith, C. Hadley
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Campus Farm (Ithaca College); Farms--New York (State)--Ithaca; Horseback riding--New York (State)--Ithaca.
Education; Architecture; Environment & Nature;

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Commencement (graduation) ceremony, Nelson Rockefeller speaking, protestors leaving at left, Hill Center, Ithaca College, Ithaca, NY, interior long view from stage right, taken May 16, 1970.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Shows some of est. 200 students, parents, faculty members, and administration leaving the ceremony to protest Rockefeller's speech & honorary degree. Rockefeller, a rich supporter of the Vietnam War, was not a popular choice at a time of Nixon's escalation of the war and the killing of student protestors at Kent State U. During the ceremony, Rockefeller, faculty member Frank Darrow, & senior class president John McGhan, all spoke of the need to work for peace--The Ithaca College Story, by John Harcourt, p.128-129.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Smith, C. Hadley
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Rockefeller, Nelson A.;Commencement (1970: Ithaca College); Graduation ceremonies--New York (State)--Ithaca; Student movements---New York (State)--Ithaca.
People; Education;
oai_dc:dc.dc:contributor: Reproduced by Ithaca College Archives & Special Collections

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Commencement (graduation) speaker Nelson A. Rockefeller, close view in Hill Center, Ithaca College, Ithaca, NY, taken May 16, 1970.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Rockefeller, as a supporter of the Vietnam war and member of the military-industrial establishment, was not a popular choice at this time with campus antiwar activists, and 200 est. protestors walked out on his speech. He offered to mediate between students' needs and President Nixon.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Smith, C. Hadley
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Rockefeller, Nelson A.; Commencement (1970: Ithaca College); Graduation ceremonies----New York (State)--Ithaca; Rockefeller, Nelson A.;
People; Education;
oai_dc:dc.dc:contributor: Reproduced by Ithaca College Archives & Special Collections

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Mid-Century Convocation, Eleanor Steber,Ithaca College, Ithaca, NY, taken May 11, 1951.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Shows Eleanor Steber, Metropolitan Opera soprano, at the 1st convocation session in Ithaca Senior High School. The Convocation brought together leaders in government, business, the professions, sports, & the arts, for musical performances & presentations on means to promote international understanding & world peace through the mass media.
